newsitem.title: LATVIA: Latvian share turnover dips but most stocks firm.
newsitem.headline: Latvian share turnover dips but most stocks firm.

text.p: Turnover on the Latvian stock exchange slipped further on Monday although most stocks gained slightly, the bourse said.
The stock exchange was trading for the first time on a Monday, bringing it up to five days a week trade sessions. Overall turnover was 76,522 lats versus Friday's 133,740 lats.

Staburadze on the official list was most traded on turnover of 16,549 lats as it climbed strongly to 2.55 lats from 2.40 lats. Unibanka turned over 7,865 lats and was slightly higher at 3.25 lats versus 3.20 lats. Riga Transport Fleet saw activity of 12,194 lats for a gain of one santime to 1.61.

On the secondary list, Kaija saw trade of 16,044 lats but was unchanged at two lats while Salacgriva, also a fish cannery, traded 9,200 lats to be one the few fallers. It slipped to 4.60 lats from 5.23 lats.
Daugavpils Chain was also active on 5,266 lats of trade and also fell slightly, hitting 2.11 after 2.12 lats.
Other shares were quiet, apart from Rigas Raugs yeast plant on activity of 2,400 lats to remain unchanged at four lats.
